MC	<p>501a_3c0e</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene A</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene E</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>elephant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene E</span> cells absorb excessive amounts of liquid, resulting in giant, swollen cells.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene M</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">33</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">6,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and E</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,200) + 3&times;(31)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">600 + 93</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">693</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1050 = <strong>10.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,749 + 99</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,650</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,200 + 2,298) + 3&times;(31 + 134)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,244</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3400 = <strong>34 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,200) + 3&times;(31 + 33)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">600 + 192</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">792</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1200 = <strong>12 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>1b40_4556</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene A</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene K</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene T</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">169</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">19,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and T</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,494) + 3&times;(7)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">747 + 21</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">768</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.0400 = <strong>4 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,494 + 8,202) + 3&times;(7 + 169)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,848 + 528</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,376</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2800 = <strong>28 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,494) + 3&times;(7 + 64)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">960</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.0500 = <strong>5 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,494 + 8,202) + 3&times;(7 + 64 + 169)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,848 + 720</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,568</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2900 = <strong>29 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(8,202) + 3&times;(64 + 169)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,101 + 699</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,800</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>2032_5702</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene K</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene N</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>nude</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene N</span> cells have an unusually smooth surface with no visible external features or textures.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene T</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">k</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes K and N</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,030 + 5,112) + 3&times;(75 + 250)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,071 + 975</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,046</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.2900 = <strong>29 cM</strong>	Correct	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,030) + 3&times;(75)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,515 + 225</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,740</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1000 = <strong>10 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,480</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,914</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1100 = <strong>11 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>3033_c514</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene D</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>doubled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene D</span> cells display double or multiple budding, with several buds emerging simultaneously.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene J</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene K</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes J and K</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,782) + 3&times;(310)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">18,450</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,391 + 930</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">18,450</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,952</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">18,450</td></tr></table> = 0.1600 = <strong>16 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>c74e_df19</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene E</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>elephant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene E</span> cells absorb excessive amounts of liquid, resulting in giant, swollen cells.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene M</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene T</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">m</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes M and T</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(7,728) + 3&times;(141 + 451)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">28,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,864 + 1,776</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">28,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>5eb2_db71</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene A</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene B</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene M</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and B</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,780) + 3&times;(60 + 138)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,890 + 594</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,484</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = 0.0900 = <strong>9 cM</strong>	Correct	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(8,418) + 3&times;(299)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,209 + 897</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,106</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1850 = <strong>18.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(8,418) + 3&times;(138 + 299)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,520</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">27,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>312c_4228</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene B</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene N</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>nude</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene N</span> cells have an unusually smooth surface with no visible external features or textures.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene X</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes B and N</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>7660_b96e</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene D</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>doubled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene D</span> cells display double or multiple budding, with several buds emerging simultaneously.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene X</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene Y</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>yolk</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene Y</span> cells develop a dense, yellowish core that resembles an egg yolk when viewed under a microscope.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes D and X</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>c626_b2b1</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene C</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene J</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene R</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes C and R</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">840</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,000</td></tr></table> = 0.0350 = <strong>3.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,800</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Correct	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>edba_d317</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene J</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene P</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene R</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes J and R</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,200 + 384</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">13,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>9a28_56a7</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene A</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene F</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene X</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and F</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,640) + 3&times;(130 + 230)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,820 + 1,080</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,900</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,500</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,655</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,500</td></tr></table> = 0.2900 = <strong>29 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>14c9_0bfe</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene K</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene P</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene Y</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>yolk</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene Y</span> cells develop a dense, yellowish core that resembles an egg yolk when viewed under a microscope.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">k</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes P and Y</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>992d_d781</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene A</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene J</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene P</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">12,075</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">26,250</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and J</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,804) + 3&times;(350 + 441)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">26,250</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,402 + 2,373</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">26,250</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,775</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">26,250</td></tr></table> = 0.2200 = <strong>22 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,510 + 3,465</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">26,250</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">9,975</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">26,250</td></tr></table> = 0.3800 = <strong>38 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>017e_c7cb</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene B</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008080;">Gene C</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #008080;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008080;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene F</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes B and C</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,339 + 441</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,780</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1750 = <strong>17.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">939 + 141</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,080</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.0500 = <strong>5 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>6585_f728</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene K</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene T</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene W</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">k</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">k</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes K and W</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>3c54_cd16</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene A</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene C</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene F</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">294</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">17,400</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and F</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,326) + 3&times;(203 + 294)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,163 + 1,491</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,654</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.2100 = <strong>21 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,326) + 3&times;(294)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,163 + 882</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,045</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1750 = <strong>17.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,326 + 4,980) + 3&times;(294 + 417)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,653 + 2,133</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,786</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.3900 = <strong>39 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,980) + 3&times;(203 + 417)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,490 + 1,860</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,350</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,980) + 3&times;(417)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,490 + 1,251</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,741</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.2150 = <strong>21.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>a954_e920</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene F</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene T</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene W</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">w</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">w</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">76</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">9,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes F and W</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,136) + 3&times;(48 + 76)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,068 + 372</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,440</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,722 + 2,136) + 3&times;(49 + 76)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,929 + 375</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,304</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2400 = <strong>24 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,722) + 3&times;(48 + 49)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">861 + 291</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,152</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1200 = <strong>12 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,136) + 3&times;(76)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,068 + 228</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,296</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1350 = <strong>13.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,722 + 2,136) + 3&times;(48 + 49 + 76)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,929 + 519</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,448</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">9,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2550 = <strong>25.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>1847_61ba</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene C</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene R</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene T</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse;
