display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,275</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">5,100</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>3ff7_ceeb</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene B</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008080;">Gene R</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #008080;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008080;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene T</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">r</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">585</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">22,500</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes R and T</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(7,290) + 3&times;(585)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,645 + 1,755</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,400</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = 0.2400 = <strong>24 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,310) + 3&times;(240)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,655 + 720</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,375</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,310) + 3&times;(75 + 240)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,655 + 945</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = 0.1600 = <strong>16 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(7,290) + 3&times;(75 + 585)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,645 + 1,980</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,625</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,310 + 7,290) + 3&times;(240 + 585)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,300 + 2,475</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">8,775</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">22,500</td></tr></table> = 0.3900 = <strong>39 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>10af_aa3c</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene B</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene J</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene W</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">w</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">w</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">127</span></td></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">2</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">40</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">6,000</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes B and W</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,878) + 3&times;(127)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">939 + 381</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,320</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2200 = <strong>22 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,266 + 1,878) + 3&times;(40 + 49 + 127)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,572 + 648</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,220</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.3700 = <strong>37 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,878) + 3&times;(40 + 127)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">939 + 501</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,440</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2400 = <strong>24 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,266) + 3&times;(49)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">633 + 147</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">780</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.1300 = <strong>13 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,266 + 1,878) + 3&times;(49 + 127)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,572 + 528</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,100</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.3500 = <strong>35 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>ffb1_13b4</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene M</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene P</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene T</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">20</span></td></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">2</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes P and T</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>7fa6_a588</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene A</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene P</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene X</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes P and X</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,522 + 4,578) + 3&times;(125)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,425</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2950 = <strong>29.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,289 + 1,461</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,750</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,522 + 4,578) + 3&times;(188 + 362)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>6c5b_8e6d</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene B</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene R</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene W</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes B and W</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>9f42_8f91</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene N</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>nude</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene N</span> cells have an unusually smooth surface with no visible external features or textures.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene P</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene R</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace;">n</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">n</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes N and P</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,544 + 6,552) + 3&times;(336 + 483)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">23,625</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,048 + 2,457</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">23,625</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">8,505</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">23,625</td></tr></table> = 0.3600 = <strong>36 cM</strong>	Correct	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,544 + 6,552) + 3&times;(315 + 336 + 483)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">23,625</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">9,450</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">23,625</td></tr></table> = 0.4000 = <strong>40 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,276 + 1,449</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">23,625</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,725</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">23,625</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>1204_360f</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene E</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>elephant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene E</span> cells absorb excessive amounts of liquid, resulting in giant, swollen cells.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene K</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene M</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">24</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">6,000</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes E and M</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(996 + 1,350) + 3&times;(24 + 45)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,173 + 207</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,380</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2300 = <strong>23 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(996 + 1,350) + 3&times;(24 + 30 + 45)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,173 + 297</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,470</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2450 = <strong>24.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(996) + 3&times;(24 + 30)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">498 + 162</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">660</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.1100 = <strong>11 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,350) + 3&times;(24 + 45)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">675 + 207</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">882</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.1470 = <strong>14.70 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,350) + 3&times;(30 + 45)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">675 + 225</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">900</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>28bf_c72c</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene K</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene M</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene W</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">k</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">k</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">4,385</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">10,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes K and M</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,228) + 3&times;(51 + 227)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,614 + 834</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,448</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2400 = <strong>24 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,220) + 3&times;(51 + 89)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,110 + 420</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,530</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,228) + 3&times;(227)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,295</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2250 = <strong>22.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,220) + 3&times;(89)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,377</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1350 = <strong>13.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,724 + 948</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,672</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3600 = <strong>36 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>0012_8e6c</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene R</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene T</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene X</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace;">r</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">r</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">8,820</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">21,000</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes R and T</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,046 + 6,084) + 3&times;(314 + 491)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,565 + 2,415</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">7,980</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = 0.3800 = <strong>38 cM</strong>	Correct	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,046 + 6,084) + 3&times;(245)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,565 + 735</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,300</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = 0.3000 = <strong>30 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,046) + 3&times;(314)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,523 + 942</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,465</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = 0.1650 = <strong>16.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,084) + 3&times;(245 + 491)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,042 + 2,208</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,250</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,046) + 3&times;(245 + 314)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,523 + 1,677</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,200</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>13db_231c</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene D</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>doubled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene D</span> cells display double or multiple budding, with several buds emerging simultaneously.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene R</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene Y</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>yolk</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene Y</span> cells develop a dense, yellowish core that resembles an egg yolk when viewed under a microscope.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes D and R</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>bede_b86d</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene J</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene P</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene X</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">x</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">414</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">19,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes J and P</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,828 + 6,348) + 3&times;(128 + 130 + 414)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,088 + 2,016</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">7,104</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3700 = <strong>37 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,174 + 1,626</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,800</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>8138_87de</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene E</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>elephant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene E</span> cells absorb excessive amounts of liquid, resulting in giant, swollen cells.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene J</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene N</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>nude</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene N</span> cells have an unusually smooth surface with no visible external features or textures.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">n</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">12,796</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">21,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes J and N</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,866) + 3&times;(108 + 161)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,433 + 807</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,240</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Correct	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,582 + 4,866) + 3&times;(87 + 161)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,224 + 744</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,968</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2300 = <strong>23 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,582) + 3&times;(87 + 108)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,376</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1100 = <strong>11 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,866) + 3&times;(161)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,433 + 483</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,916</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1350 = <strong>13.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>5936_b2cf</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene N</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>nude</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene N</span> cells have an unusually smooth surface with no visible external features or textures.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene P</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene T</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse;
