color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">p</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">p</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">n</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">n</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">402</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">17,100</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes N and P</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,290) + 3&times;(311)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,145 + 933</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,078</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = 0.1800 = <strong>18 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,290 + 4,770) + 3&times;(311 + 402)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,530 + 2,139</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,669</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = 0.3900 = <strong>39 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,770) + 3&times;(228 + 402)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,385 + 1,890</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,275</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,770) + 3&times;(402)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,385 + 1,206</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,591</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = 0.2100 = <strong>21 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,290) + 3&times;(228 + 311)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,145 + 1,617</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,762</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,100</td></tr></table> = 0.2200 = <strong>22 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>1f35_1f54</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene J</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene M</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene Y</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>yolk</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene Y</span> cells develop a dense, yellowish core that resembles an egg yolk when viewed under a microscope.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">y</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">j</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">35</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">10,500</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes J and Y</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,824 + 3,090) + 3&times;(35 + 46 + 150)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,457 + 693</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,150</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = 0.3000 = <strong>30 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,090) + 3&times;(35 + 150)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,545 + 555</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,100</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,824) + 3&times;(46)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">912 + 138</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,050</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = 0.1000 = <strong>10 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,824 + 3,090) + 3&times;(46 + 150)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,457 + 588</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,045</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = 0.2900 = <strong>29 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,824) + 3&times;(35 + 46)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">912 + 243</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,155</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">10,500</td></tr></table> = 0.1100 = <strong>11 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>9c4b_c736</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #999900;">Gene A</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #999900;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #999900;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene C</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene W</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">135</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">16,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and W</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,682 + 5,580) + 3&times;(135)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,131 + 405</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,536</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2800 = <strong>28 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,682) + 3&times;(66 + 135)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,341 + 603</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,944</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1200 = <strong>12 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,682 + 5,580) + 3&times;(66 + 135 + 285)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,131 + 1,458</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,589</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3450 = <strong>34.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,682 + 5,580) + 3&times;(66 + 285)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,131 + 1,053</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,184</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3200 = <strong>32 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,580) + 3&times;(135 + 285)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,790 + 1,260</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,050</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">16,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>e661_b807</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene A</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene C</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008080;">Gene J</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #008080;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008080;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace;">a</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">2,685</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">6,000</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes A and J</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,176 + 1,914) + 3&times;(44 + 121)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,545 + 495</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,040</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.3400 = <strong>34 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,914) + 3&times;(60 + 121)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">957 + 543</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,500</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,176) + 3&times;(44)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">588 + 132</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">720</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.1200 = <strong>12 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,914) + 3&times;(121)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">957 + 363</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,320</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.2200 = <strong>22 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,176 + 1,914) + 3&times;(44 + 60 + 121)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,545 + 675</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,220</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">6,000</td></tr></table> = 0.3700 = <strong>37 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>9a67_c6f9</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene C</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene F</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene M</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">m</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">m</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">10,558</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">19,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes C and F</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,016 + 6,396) + 3&times;(16 + 182)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,206 + 594</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,800</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,016 + 6,396) + 3&times;(16 + 32 + 182)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,206 + 690</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,896</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2550 = <strong>25.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,396) + 3&times;(32 + 182)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,198 + 642</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,840</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,396) + 3&times;(182)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,198 + 546</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,744</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1950 = <strong>19.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,016) + 3&times;(16 + 32)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,008 + 144</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,152</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.0600 = <strong>6 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>c33a_90b8</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene E</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>elephant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene E</span> cells absorb excessive amounts of liquid, resulting in giant, swollen cells.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene W</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene Y</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>yolk</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene Y</span> cells develop a dense, yellowish core that resembles an egg yolk when viewed under a microscope.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">y</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">e</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">36</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">21,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes E and W</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(7,782) + 3&times;(36 + 467)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,891 + 1,509</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,400</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,990) + 3&times;(36 + 91)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,995 + 381</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,376</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1100 = <strong>11 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(7,782) + 3&times;(467)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,891 + 1,401</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,292</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2450 = <strong>24.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,990 + 7,782) + 3&times;(91 + 467)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,886 + 1,674</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">7,560</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3500 = <strong>35 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,990) + 3&times;(91)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,995 + 273</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,268</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">21,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1050 = <strong>10.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>c189_508a</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene D</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>doubled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene D</span> cells display double or multiple budding, with several buds emerging simultaneously.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene J</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #4d9900;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #4d9900;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene X</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">354</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">24,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes D and X</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,240) + 3&times;(354)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,120 + 1,062</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,182</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1700 = <strong>17 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,664) + 3&times;(286)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,832 + 858</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,690</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,664 + 6,240) + 3&times;(286 + 354)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,952 + 1,920</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">7,872</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3200 = <strong>32 cM</strong>	Correct	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,664) + 3&times;(246 + 286)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,832 + 1,596</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,428</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1800 = <strong>18 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,664 + 6,240) + 3&times;(246 + 286 + 354)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,952 + 2,658</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">8,610</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">24,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3500 = <strong>35 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>890c_d89b</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene C</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene N</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>nude</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene N</span> cells have an unusually smooth surface with no visible external features or textures.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #076cab;">Gene P</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #076cab;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #076cab;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">4</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">3,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes C and N</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(408 + 1,446) + 3&times;(4 + 12 + 47)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">927 + 189</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,116</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3100 = <strong>31 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(408) + 3&times;(4 + 12)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">252</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.0700 = <strong>7 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,446) + 3&times;(47)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">723 + 141</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">864</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2400 = <strong>24 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(408 + 1,446) + 3&times;(4 + 47)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">927 + 153</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,080</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3000 = <strong>30 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(408) + 3&times;(4)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">204 + 12</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">216</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.0600 = <strong>6 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>77d6_afce</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene A</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>amber</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene A</span> cells develop a rich yellow-orange pigmentation, giving the colony a warm, amber hue.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene B</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene P</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes B and P</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,540</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,700</td></tr></table> = 0.2000 = <strong>20 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,146 + 5,058) + 3&times;(253 + 396)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,700</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,602 + 1,947</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,700</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,549</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,700</td></tr></table> = 0.3700 = <strong>37 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>45e0_45bb</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene C</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene F</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene K</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes C and K</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>02f0_0b40</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene B</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene F</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene H</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>hairy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene H</span> cells develop long, thread-like filaments that extend outward, creating a hairy, shaggy texture on the colony.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">h</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">b</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">129</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">25,800</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes F and H</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,340) + 3&times;(129 + 185)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,670 + 942</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,612</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = 0.1400 = <strong>14 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,340 + 8,592) + 3&times;(185 + 589)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,966 + 2,322</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">9,288</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = 0.3600 = <strong>36 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,340 + 8,592) + 3&times;(129 + 185 + 589)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,966 + 2,709</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">9,675</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = 0.3750 = <strong>37.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(5,340) + 3&times;(185)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,670 + 555</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,225</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = 0.1250 = <strong>12.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(8,592) + 3&times;(129 + 589)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,296 + 2,154</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,450</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,800</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>695e_707c</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene C</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008066;">Gene D</span></strong> is connected with the '<span style="color: #008066;"><i>doubled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008066;">Gene D</span> cells display double or multiple budding, with several buds emerging simultaneously.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene J</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>jeweled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene J</span> colonies appear dotted with tiny, iridescent spots that sparkle under light.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes C and D</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,104) + 3&times;(19 + 247)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">11,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,052 + 798</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">11,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,850</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">11,400</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,254</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">11,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1100 = <strong>11 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,106 + 4,104) + 3&times;(48 + 247)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">11,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse;
