padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">m</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">t</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">390</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">25,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes D and T</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(9,504) + 3&times;(126 + 390)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,752 + 1,548</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,300</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,474 + 9,504) + 3&times;(51 + 390)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,489 + 1,323</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">7,812</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3100 = <strong>31 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,474 + 9,504) + 3&times;(51 + 126 + 390)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,489 + 1,701</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">8,190</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3250 = <strong>32.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,474) + 3&times;(51)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,737 + 153</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,890</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.0750 = <strong>7.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,474) + 3&times;(51 + 126)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,737 + 531</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,268</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.0900 = <strong>9 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>a624_5fc5</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene C</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008080;">Gene R</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #008080;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008080;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene W</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">70</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">17,400</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes R and W</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,626) + 3&times;(70)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,313 + 210</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,523</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1450 = <strong>14.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,188 + 4,626) + 3&times;(5 + 70)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,907 + 225</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,132</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1800 = <strong>18 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,626) + 3&times;(29 + 70)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,610</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Correct	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,188) + 3&times;(5 + 29)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">696</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.0400 = <strong>4 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,907 + 312</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,219</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">17,400</td></tr></table> = 0.1850 = <strong>18.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>72a6_37af</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene B</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>bubbly</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene B</span> produces excessive gas bubbles during growth, causing foamy appearance of the media.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene H</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>hairy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene H</span> cells develop long, thread-like filaments that extend outward, creating a hairy, shaggy texture on the colony.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene P</span></strong> is associated with the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">126</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">25,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes B and P</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,194 + 2,106</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; MC	<p>88d3_6801</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene F</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene W</span></strong> is correlated with the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene X</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">x</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">545</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">25,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes W and X</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,656) + 3&times;(42 + 106)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,328 + 444</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,772</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1100 = <strong>11 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(9,078) + 3&times;(42 + 545)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,539 + 1,761</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,300</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,656 + 9,078) + 3&times;(42 + 106 + 545)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,867 + 2,079</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">8,946</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3550 = <strong>35.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,656) + 3&times;(106)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,328 + 318</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,646</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1050 = <strong>10.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,656 + 9,078) + 3&times;(106 + 545)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,867 + 1,953</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">8,820</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3500 = <strong>35 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>601d_01cb</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b37100;">Gene H</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #b37100;"><i>hairy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b37100;">Gene H</span> cells develop long, thread-like filaments that extend outward, creating a hairy, shaggy texture on the colony.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene M</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene P</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">p</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #b30000;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffffcc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">m</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ccd9ff"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">p</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">h</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">h</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">160</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">19,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes M and P</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,180 + 6,612) + 3&times;(78 + 338)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,896 + 1,248</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">6,144</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.3200 = <strong>32 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,180 + 6,612) + 3&times;(160)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,896 + 480</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">5,376</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2800 = <strong>28 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,612) + 3&times;(160 + 338)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,306 + 1,494</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,800</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(3,180) + 3&times;(78 + 160)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,590 + 714</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,304</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1200 = <strong>12 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,612) + 3&times;(338)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,306 + 1,014</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,320</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">19,200</td></tr></table> = 0.2250 = <strong>22.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>20af_293f</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b30000;">Gene D</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #b30000;"><i>doubled</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b30000;">Gene D</span> cells display double or multiple budding, with several buds emerging simultaneously.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008000;">Gene H</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #008000;"><i>hairy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008000;">Gene H</span> cells develop long, thread-like filaments that extend outward, creating a hairy, shaggy texture on the colony.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #004080;">Gene P</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #004080;"><i>pebble</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #004080;">Gene P</span> produces colonies with a rough, uneven surface that resembles a collection of tiny pebbles.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">d</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1,503</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">3,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes H and P</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,176) + 3&times;(18 + 86)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">588 + 312</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">900</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(786 + 1,176) + 3&times;(18 + 31 + 86)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">981 + 405</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,386</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3850 = <strong>38.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(786) + 3&times;(18 + 31)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">393 + 147</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">540</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,176) + 3&times;(86)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">588 + 258</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">846</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2350 = <strong>23.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(786 + 1,176) + 3&times;(31 + 86)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">981 + 351</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,332</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">3,600</td></tr></table> = 0.3700 = <strong>37 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>e4af_1151</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #b34100;">Gene F</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #b34100;"><i>fuzzy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #b34100;">Gene F</span> colonies are covered in soft, fine filaments, giving them a fuzzy, cotton-like texture.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene H</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>hairy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene H</span> cells develop long, thread-like filaments that extend outward, creating a hairy, shaggy texture on the colony.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene R</span></strong> is linked with the '<span style="color: #690f8a;"><i>rusty</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #690f8a;">Gene R</span> colonies develop a reddish-brown pigmentation, reminiscent of rusted metal.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; padding-right: 5px;"><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 0px; padding-left: 50px; padding-right: 50px;"><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 0px; background-color: #ffcccc"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace;">f</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">155</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">15,600</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes H and R</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,364 + 4,218) + 3&times;(48 + 155)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,291 + 609</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,900</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2500 = <strong>25 cM</strong>	Correct	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,218) + 3&times;(78 + 155)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,109 + 699</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,808</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1800 = <strong>18 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,364) + 3&times;(48 + 78)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,182 + 378</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,560</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1000 = <strong>10 cM</strong>	Incorrect	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,364 + 4,218) + 3&times;(48 + 78 + 155)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,291 + 843</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,134</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = 0.2650 = <strong>26.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(4,218) + 3&times;(155)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,109 + 465</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">2,574</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">15,600</td></tr></table> = 0.1650 = <strong>16.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect
MC	<p>af75_2775</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #663300;">Gene T</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #663300;"><i>toxic</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #663300;">Gene T</span> secretes a toxic compound that inhibits or kills other microbial colonies nearby.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #008080;">Gene W</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #008080;"><i>webbed</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #008080;">Gene W</span> colonies produce delicate, web-like strands that connect neighboring colonies in a cobweb pattern.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #800055;">Gene X</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #800055;"><i>xenon</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #800055;">Gene X</span> cells emit a faint glow under UV light, as if they were fluorescent.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes T and X</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,528</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1400 = <strong>14 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,260</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.0500 = <strong>5 cM</strong>	Incorrect	C. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(6,090) + 3&times;(119)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">3,402</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1350 = <strong>13.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(2,178 + 6,090) + 3&times;(15 + 119)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,134 + 402</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">4,536</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">25,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1800 = <strong>18 cM</strong>	Correct
MC	<p>4177_2585</p> <h5>Unordered Tetrad Three Gene Mapping</h5><p>In this problem, you will use unordered tetrads to determine the between a single pair of genes and calculate the distances between them. The yeast <i>Saccharomyces cerevisiae</i> is used in this study. A cross has been performed to study the linkage relationships among three genes, and the resulting genotypes are summarized in the table below.</p><h6>Characteristics of Recessive Phenotypes</h6><p><ul><li><strong><span style="color: #465927;">Gene C</span></strong> is analogous to the '<span style="color: #465927;"><i>clumpy</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #465927;">Gene C</span> grows in dense, irregular clusters, with cells clumping together rather than spreading smoothly.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #002db3;">Gene K</span></strong> is related to the '<span style="color: #002db3;"><i>knotted</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #002db3;">Gene K</span> cells grow in twisted, coiled shapes, resulting in a knotted or gnarled appearance.</li> <li><strong><span style="color: #99004d;">Gene M</span></strong> is affiliated with the '<span style="color: #99004d;"><i>militant</i></span>' phenotype. A budding yeast that is homozygous recessive for <span style="color: #99004d;">Gene M</span> colonies are small, dense, and secrete compounds that inhibit the growth of nearby colonies.</li> </ul></p><table style="border-collapse: collapse; border: 2px solid black; width: 400px; height: 220px;"><tr> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Set #</th> <th colspan="4" align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Tetrad Genotypes</th> <th align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;">Progeny<br/>Count</th></tr><tr> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">1</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;"><div style="padding-left: 5px; font-family: monospace;">c</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #999900;">+</span></td> <td align="center" style="border: 0px;"><span style="font-size: large; font-family: monospace; color: #002db3;">+</span></td></tr></table></div></span></td> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;"><span style="font-size: medium;">4,751</span></td></tr><tr> <th colspan="5" align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">TOTAL =</th> <td align="right" style="border: 1px solid black;">7,200</td></tr></table><p>The resulting phenotypes are summarized in the table above.</p> <h6>Step-by-Step Instructions</h6><ul> <li>Step 1: Find the row for the Parental Type for all three genes.</li> <li>Step 2: Looking at only your two genes, assign PD, NPD, TT.</li> <li>Step 3: Determine if the two genes are linked.</li> <ul><li>PD &gt;&gt; NPD &rarr; linked; PD &approx; NPD &rarr; unlinked</li></ul> <li>Step 4: Determine the map distance between the two genes.</li> <ul><li>D = &half; (TT + 6 NPD) / total = (3 NPD + &half; TT) / total</li></ul></ul><h5>Determine the distance between the two genes C and K</h5>	A. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(492 + 1,914) + 3&times;(2 + 29)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,203 + 93</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,296</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1800 = <strong>18 cM</strong>	Incorrect	B. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(492) + 3&times;(2)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">288</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = 0.0400 = <strong>4 cM</strong>	Correct	D. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,914) + 3&times;(12 + 29)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">957 + 123</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,080</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1500 = <strong>15 cM</strong>	Incorrect	E. distance = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">&half;(1,914) + 3&times;(29)</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">957 + 87</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = <table style="border-collapse: collapse; display: inline-table; vertical-align: middle;"> <tr><td style="border-bottom: 1px solid black; text-align: center;">1,044</td></tr> <tr><td style="text-align: center;">7,200</td></tr></table> = 0.1450 = <strong>14.50 cM</strong>	Incorrect
